result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie L Metoxen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1b.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02/02/17: The Court extends the Probation term for 1 year.

1/25/18:The Court extends probation for 1 year from 2/26/18 to 2/26/19.

**2/4/19: The Court extends Mr. Metoxen's probation for one year, to allow for payment of restitution. **

miscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $609.50, payable to US Bank, joint & several with co-actor

--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge

--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs

--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent

--Maintain absolute sobriety

--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed

--To attempt obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: FORT ATKINSON PD
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent

[MK] case called at 2:21pm 
Defendant Jamie L Metoxen not in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes that the balance due on restitution is $414.50, and that none of the court financial obligations have been paid. The Court cannot find that there has been a good faith effort to pay.
On Motion of the State, the Court extends Probation for a one year to February 4th 2023 or until these obligations are satisfied, whichever comes first.

Case called at 3:39 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jamie L Metoxen in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel clarify for the Court that the in regards to the Rock County Case listed on the criminal case settlement, the State will not be filing bailjumping charges based on the events from 11/10/15.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3

On Count #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--To attempt obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $609.50, payable to US Bank, joint & several with co-actor
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 3:50 pm
and Transport the Defendant from the Rock County Jail on 2-26-16 for proceedings in Branch 4

Case called at 9:18am
[Scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Jamie L Metoxen in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Mr. Metoxen indicate that he does NOT qualify for SPD representation; requests time to obtain counsel/have Court appoint counsel
The Court orders Mr. Metoxen to the COC to obtain a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.
The Court orders Mr. Metoxen to fill out a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel and return to the courtroom for review. 
The Court warns Mr. Metoxen that if he does not return, the Court will issue a warrant. 
recess: 9:28am---reconvene: 9:45am

Mr. Metoxen presents the Court with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel; the Court reviews with Mr. Metoxen.
The Court finds Mr. Metoxen eligible for Court Appointed Counsel 
The Court orders that Mr. Metoxen pay towards his Court Appointed Attorney fees in the amount of $100 per month, beginning on 12/15/15 and on the 15th of every month thereafter until otherwise directed by the Court.
The Court appoints Attorney David Zarwell to Mr. Metoxen's case. 
Mr. Metoxen indicates that his address is now Church St. in Beloit.

recess: 9:55am

NEXT:  Status Conference on 12/18/15 at 1:15pm
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-13-2015 09:30 am

Case called at 10:16 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for adjourned initial appearance)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jamie L Metoxen not in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that someone claiming to be Defendant called the Clerk's office and inidcated that his transportation fell through, but he was attempting to find alternate arrangements.
Court on its own motion puts case over to the end of it's morning calendar to see if Defendant arrives.
Recess: 10:16 am Reconvene: 12:10 pm Appearances are the same
Court notes that Mr. Metoxen still does not appear. ADA Shock: Requests the Court issue warrant
Court grants request but STAYS warrant until next calling of case 11/13/15 at 9:30 am - If Mr. Metoxen fails to appear at that time, warrant will issue at that time
Recess: 12:12 pm

NEXT: Reschedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 11/13/15 at 9:30 am - Send notices
